title: Creating Sports Programs For Urban School Students
teaser: As more sports programs are cut from public schools, WBUR's Karen Given has the story on Up2Us, an organization that is filling the gap.
contentencoded:
Physical activity and sports are linked with better physical health, mental health, and educational outcomes for youth.

But as sports budgets are slashed, especially in urban public school districts, an organization is stepping in to provide support and training for hundreds of the country’s sports-based youth development programs.

From the Here & Now Contributors Network, Karen Given of WBUR has the story of Up2Us.

  • WBUR: Up2Us: Trauma-Sensitive Coaching Transforms Urban Youth Sports

Reporter

  • Karen Given, producer and reporter for WBUR and NPR’s “Only a Game.” She tweets @klgiven.
